cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across south Florida tonight, then emerging into the southeastern Gulf of Mexico Saturday and turning northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Florida coastline near Miami-Dade County

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern Florida tonight and Saturday, then northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana to Alabama early next week
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 25–35 mph possible tonight through Saturday morning as the center crosses south Florida
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected on the Atlantic side at PortMiami
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches common with isolated 5 inches; risk of localized flash flooding at the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief squalls reducing visibility, rough harbor seas and embedded thunderstorms may disrupt cargo handling
